required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: Effects of Kinesiotaping on Post-Needling Soreness by Dry Needling on Active Trigger Points

brief_summary.textblock: Application of trigger point dry needling can induce post-dry needling soreness. This is not a negative experience, but sometimes some patients want to reduce it as much as possible. Different therapeutic strategies targeting to decrease post-dry needling soreness need to be investigated. Since Kinesiotaping has been advocated for decreasing tone in the muscle tissues, it would be a potential intervention for this objective.

primary_outcome.measure: Changes in post-dry needling pain intensity before and after the intervention
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, immediately after, 24 hours after, 48 hours after and 72 hours after treatment
primary_outcome.description: A Numerical Pain Rate Scale (NPRS, 0-10) will be used to record post-dry needling soreness and pain

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in cervical related-disability before and after the intervention
secondary_outcome.description: The Neck Disability Index (NDI) will be used

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in upper extremity related-disability before and after the intervention
secondary_outcome.description: The Shoulder Pain and Disability Index (SPADI) questionnaire will be used

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, immediately after and 72 hours after treatment
secondary_outcome.description: Pressure pain threshold over the Trigger Point area will be assessed

arm_group.description: A Kinesiotaping will be provided over the upper trapezius muscle after the application of dry needling
Individuals will not perform any action after the application of trigger point dry needling

intervention.description: A Kinesiotaping will be provided over the upper trapezius muscle after the application of dry needling
Individuals will not perform any action after the application of trigger point dry needling
